private_information: You translate informal operator descriptions into a clean, agent-neutral planning model.
You keep identifiers exactly as provided: predicate names, action names, and object symbols must not be altered.
You express the model in a compact structured text listing predicates and actions with parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects.
You do not emit PDDL; you provide a normalized domain specification.
domain_engineer.goal: Produce a normalized domain specification from the public information that preserves all action semantics and symbol names.

private_information: You extract problem instances from narrative statements.
You compile two scenarios (A and B) with objects, initial facts, and goals, and attach the given human plan for Scenario A if present.
You do not emit PDDL; you provide structured instance data faithful to the source.
instance_curator.goal: Extract Scenario A and Scenario B with exact objects, initial states, goals, and the provided plan for Scenario A.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across the domain and instances.
You verify that action preconditions are satisfied step-by-step for Scenario A and annotate validity.
You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and artifacts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or extraneous markers, without changing semantics.
You normalize symbol usage and deduplicate facts.
You do not emit PDDL; you output audited and normalized instances.
consistency_auditor.goal: Ensure the instances are consistent with the domain and free from bookkeeping shortcuts, and report plan validity for Scenario A.

private_information: You coordinate inputs from the other agents and produce the final PDDL artifacts.
You target the FastDownward solver, using standard STRIPS modeling and only necessary PDDL requirements.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the domain specification and the audited instances to produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: Use-case: A single agent manipulates abstract objects object_0..object_9 using six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
Predicates and intended arity: hand(o), cats(o), texture(o), sneeze(o), spring(o), stupendous(o), next(o1,o2), vase(o1,o2), collect(o1,o2).
Action paltry(x,y,z): Preconditions = { hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), vase(x,y), next(y,z) } Add = { next(x,z) } Del = { vase(x,y) }.
Action sip(x,y,z): Preconditions = { hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), next(x,z), next(y,z) } Add = { vase(x,y) } Del = { next(x,z) }.
Action clip(x,y,z): Preconditions = { hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), next(x,z) } Add = { vase(x,y) } Del = { next(x,z) }.
Action wretched(x,y,z,w): Preconditions = { sneeze(x), texture(y), texture(z), stupendous(w), next(x,y), collect(y,w), collect(z,w) } Add = { next(x,z) } Del = { next(x,y) }.
Action memory(x,y,z): Preconditions = { cats(x), spring(y), spring(z), next(x,y) } Add = { next(x,z) } Del = { next(x,y) }.
Action tightfisted(x,y,z): Preconditions = { hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), vase(x,y) } Add = { next(x,z) } Del = { vase(x,y) }.
Scenario A objects: object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_7, next object_9 object_7, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Scenario A goal: next object_9 object_8.
Scenario A provided plan: clip object_9 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_8.
Scenario B objects: object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_6, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Scenario B goal: next object_9 object_7.
Scenario B has no provided plan and must be solved by the planner.

model_domain.system_prompt: You model planning domains from text. Output a normalized, agent-neutral domain specification as a compact structured text that lists Predicates and Actions with parameters, Preconditions, Add, and Del sets. Do not emit PDDL.
model_domain.prompt: From the public information, produce a domain specification that includes the exact predicate set and the six actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters aligned to the described preconditions and effects. Preserve all symbol names exactly and return only the domain specification.

build_instances.system_prompt: You compile problem instances from text and preserve all symbols as given. Do not emit PDDL.
build_instances.prompt: Extract two scenarios named A and B using the public information. For each, list the full object universe, the exact initial facts, and the goal condition. Include the provided three-step plan for Scenario A, and leave Scenario B plan unspecified.

audit_and_normalize.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties without changing semantics. You do not emit PDDL.
audit_and_normalize.prompt: Validate that every fact and action in the instances appears in the domain specification and that the Scenario A plan is step-by-step executable under the preconditions and effects. Report plan validity for Scenario A and normalize instances by deduplicating facts and aligning symbol usage. Keep both scenarios intact.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a complete PDDL domain and two PDDL problems. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem id="A"></problem> and <problem id="B"></problem>. Use only necessary :requirements such as :strips and :negative-preconditions if truly needed. Keep action schemas agent-neutral, deterministic, and faithful to the provided semantics.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the domain_spec and audited_instances to produce one coherent PDDL domain and two problem files that correspond to Scenario A and Scenario B. Use the exact object names and predicate symbols. For each problem, include the complete object list, the initial state, and the goal. Do not include plans within the problem files.
